page.title: 01 Introduction
page.content: Wellow is a growing Hampshire country village split by the A36-Canada to the east and Wellow village to the west. Canada backs onto the New Forest,and was named when many people moved to North America.The houses are mainly 19th century and there is also the Abbots Farm Nursery here. Across the A36,houses become mixed. This was once due to the number of evacuees who decided to settle here,but in recent years housing estates have been built with commuters in mind.These newer homes mixed with the old established ones and have in some cases led to controversy. Wellow is a village combining old and new and including many interesting features. By Heather Dodds,Caroline Luckhurst, Nick Doran and Rachel Patey.
